Class FileText

java.lang.Object
inout.FileText
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class FileText extends Object implements Serializable

The FileText class implements a BufferedReader and BufferedWriter object to read and write from or for a text file.
The FileText class has the following methods:
(1) turnOnReader() - open file in read mode;
(2) textReader() - read a line text in an open file in read mode;
(3) turnOffReader() - close file in read mode;
(4) turnOnWriter() - open file in read mode;
(5) textWriter() - write a line text in an open file in write mode;
(6) turnOffWriter() - close file in write mode.
Version:
22.04.a
Author:
Gilberto Rouxinol

    • turnOnReader

      public boolean turnOnReader(String fileName)
      Open text file in read mode
      Parameters:
      fileName - the name of the text file to read an object
      Returns:
      true the file exists or false the file doesn't exist
      Throws:
      IOException - If an input output exception occurred.

    • textReader

      public ArrayList<String> textReader()
      Read all line in an open text file in read mode.
      Returns:
      lineList a ArrayList(String) with all line read. Each line is one String.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an input output exception occurred.

    • turnOffReader

      public boolean turnOffReader()
      Close text file in read mode
      Returns:
      true text file closed with success or false text file not closed
      Throws:
      IOException - If an input output exception occurred.

    • turnOnWriter

      public boolean turnOnWriter(String fileName)
      Open text file in write mode
      Parameters:
      fileName - the name of the text file to write
      Returns:
      true the text file was open successfuly or false the text file wasn't open successfuly
      Throws:
      IOException - If an input output exception occurred.

    • textWriter

      public void textWriter(ArrayList<String> linesList)
      Write linesList of type ArrayList(String) in an open text file in write mode
      Parameters:
      linesList - the name of the ArrayList(String) with all the lines to write
      Throws:
      IOException - If an input output exception occurred.

    • turnOffWriter

      public boolean turnOffWriter()
      Close text file in write mode
      Returns:
      true text file closed with success or false text file not closed
      Throws:
      IOException - If an input output exception occurred.
